channel.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
channel.description:
## Lobby: > * Casual Mode is now disabled for public games. > * Improvements back end. Should improve reconnection.
## Store Content: > * Three new executions - Oracle's Earring, Lightning Rod, Bowl of Nails > * Three new Deathnote colors - Fiery Orange, Sky Teal, Stone Gray
## Quality of Life: > * Changed Probe Icon > * Added a tips section the class cards with basic tips for each class. > * Changed the order of the colors in the DN > * Mute function fixed.
## General: > * Increased amount of time to step forward to become King. > * Increased the money you get from betting on deaths. > * Occupy and redirection immunity now carries over when your class changes. > * The Mystic is now the only class immune to Mind Link & Conduit at the start, but this immunity carries over when their class changes. > * Occupation and visit prevention are now merged into one message saying you were unable to use your ability. > * Mercenary has been reworked and the Sellsword has been revived as a Neutral Offensive class. > * Added MVP system. See below for details.
## Minor Class/Ability Changes
> #### Knight: > * Will now always attack their target, even when they are Blue Dragon. > * Will now only commit suicide after they successfully attack a Blue Dragon player. (This means if the target is night immune, they will not commit suicide) > > #### Observer: > * Follow is now affected by Mind Warp. > > #### Paladin: > * Smite usable Night 3. > > #### Possessor: > * Possess now prevents the target from being healed. > > #### Reaper: > * Players can no longer emote when icy touched.
## Major Class/Ability Changes: > > #### Mercenary: > * No longer has a contract. Now must see the Unseen/Cult defeated in order to win. Does not have to be alive at the end. > * Remains conversion immune. > * Removed Connections and Rebound. > * Stand Guard is now a targetable ability, but you cannot target the same player two nights in a row. Unlimited uses. > * New Ability Shield - Shield a player, dying in their place if they are attacked at night. Will stay on the target until changed. Unlimited uses. > > #### Sellsword: > * Brought back from the dead as a Neutral Offensive that must see the Blue Dragon defeated in order to win. Does not have to be alive at the end. > * Occupy, redirection, and conversion immune. > * Stonewall prevents all non-attacking visits to your target. Cannot target the same player two nights in a row. Unlimited uses. > * New Ability Intimidate - Occupy a player. > > #### Sheriff: > * Scout will no longer tell you if a player was converted, and will instead tell you if the Unseen visited targeted player. > * Added new ability Surveillance - Determine a player's class if they are a member of the Unseen. 3 uses.
## MVP System: > * At the end of the match, before the end screen, players can pick the top 3 players they think contributed to the game. > * The top three players will receive gold. > * 1st place receives 250 gold. > * 2nd place receives 125 gold. > * 3rd place receives 75 gold.

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Lily
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Why would you ever want to convert a sellsword?

For the lolz.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Guys all I saw was you both arguing back and forth

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I meant everyone knows Possessor knows he must either jump to SS or GK, otherwise he dies and loses. If Poss jumps to GK, MM successfully converts SS and the game ends with a win for Unseen. If Poss jumps to SS, game doesn’t end and everyone knows Poss jumped to SS.

But actually all of this is moot. Because everyone knows that everyone knows that Poss knows his only potentially-winning move is to jump to SS and hope for the King to give him the win.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Not that. If the game doesn’t end that means the Possessor jumped. MM is night immune so it wasn’t him. King has Finger and would use it if it was him. So if the King doesn’t finger he’s Possessor (King trying to trick Everyone into thinking he is poss is irrelevant as that’s equivalent to letting poss win kingmaker)

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I thought about it and you’re right. Because if the game didn’t end then it can only mean the Sellsword got possessed.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
They would figure it out. So yes

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
When the next day begins, does everyone know who Possessor jumped to?

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Well there is no point in trying to predict someone who is illogical without a psychological profile that we obviously don’t have on hand.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Well if you add the caveat that everyone is perfectly logical and has perfect information and all this is common knowledge to all, then yes.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Because Jumping to king is a guaranteed loss (as we just established) while jumping to SS is kingmaker

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Wait fuck I just realized. Possessors best move is to jump to SS not King

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Yea it took me awhile but I realized the only thing the MM can do that might benefit him is try to convert the SS. In fact it’s the only thing he can try that might have any affect at all

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shouldn’t matter but I’ll go with 1

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
One jump or two?

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Tonight but he has a jump.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Is Possessor dying to poison tonight or next night?

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I already worked through it btw. Converting SS IS a guarenteed win for MM given everyone having perfect information (which isn’t hard given the classes in play)

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
What reason would I have for coming up with that? I defined my situation carefully in order to ensure that converting the SS was a good idea. Not sure how your situation suits my purpose. But I will try to issue an opinion … one minute lol

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Do it. Its a fun exercise

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Why didn’t you come up with that?

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Well I don’t know if converting the SS is the best option there. Do you want me to determine if it is? Why do you want me to do that?

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That’s the situation

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I never said that in YOUR situation, converting the SS is the best option for the MM.

I only said that in at least ONE possible situation (the one I gave as an example), it is.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Because there is only a limited amount of time during the day and he spent it whispering the Blue Dragon trying to figure out whether he was a Hunter or not.

There really is an infinite number of possible answers to this question.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.1.3 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
you know what? Fuck it. I’ll come up with the situation myself.

Good King (no guards or OE’s)
Possessor who is poisoned
MM
Sellsword

Everyone has perfect information

Was that really so hard?

Read full topic
